properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Mount Russell. 
  • There is a tree fire at Mount Russell.
  • Firefighters are currently responding to this fire.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads.
  • Aircraft will be operating in the area.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 10/01/2025 10:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Mount Russell
Issue Date: Friday 10 January 2025, 07:12 pm
Next Update: Friday 10 January 2025, 10:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35758/moreinfo

This Community Information message is being issued for Mount Russell. 
- There is a tree fire at Mount Russell.
- Firefighters are currently responding to this fire.
- Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads.
- Aircraft will be operating in the area.


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Flynn, Rosedale.
  • The grassfire near the Princes Highway, Flynn is now under control.
  • CFA crews will continue to extinguish remaining hot spots over the coming hours. 
  • The Rosedale-Flynns Creeks Road remains closed between the Princes Highway and Colliers Lane.  Access will be available for local residents.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following service can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Services on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - GRASS FIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Princes Highway, Flynn
Issue Date: Friday 10 January 2025, 08:03 pm
Next Update: Saturday 11 January 2025, 08:00 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35759/moreinfo

This Community Information message is being issued for Flynn, Rosedale.
- The grassfire near the Princes Highway, Flynn is now under control.
- CFA crews will continue to extinguish remaining hot spots over the coming hours. 
- The Rosedale-Flynns Creeks Road remains closed between the Princes Highway and Colliers Lane.  Access will be available for local residents.


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Cape Otway.
  • Firefighters continue to patrol and black out a bushfire off Blanket Bay Road. 
  • The bushfire started on Wednesday 8 January 2025 and is under control. 
  • This Advice replaces the message issued at 11.30am 9/01/25.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Drive to speed restrictions and be aware of emergency service vehicles. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Blanket Bay Road is open with speed restrictions in place. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Emergency services will remain in the area.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 13/01/2025 03:50 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Blanket Bay Road, Cape Otway
Issue Date: Friday 10 January 2025, 03:41 pm
Next Update: Monday 13 January 2025, 03:50 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35749/moreinfo

This Advice message is being issued for Cape Otway.
- Firefighters continue to patrol and black out a bushfire off Blanket Bay Road. 
- The bushfire started on Wednesday 8 January 2025 and is under control. 
- This Advice replaces the message issued at 11.30am 9/01/25.


There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: areas of the Grampians National Park affected by fire.
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for areas of the Grampians National Park affected by fire.
  • The bushfire in the Grampians National Park is contained.
  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 7.31pm Tuesday 7 January.
  • Firefighters and heavy machinery continue to work on the fire monitoring hotspots, treating hazardous trees and clearing tracks.
  • Small pockets of smoke within the containment area may be visible.
Parts of the Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park re opened to visitors at 9:00am Friday 10 January. For details on access to the park, visit the Parks Vic website. Plan your trip before you leave - visit VicTraffic.

  • Areas of the Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park will remain closed as they remain extremely dangerous. Fines may apply if you are found behind road closures.  

Halls Gap opened to visitors on Wednesday 8 January.

Community Newsletter no 6: Community newsletter

There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • If you see impacted wildlife - call 1300 226 226. 
Recovery and resilience
If you have been or may be impacted by bushfire, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now. For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief
Impacts in your area: 
  • Drivers may encounter fire crews and heavy machinery on roads and tracks. Please take care and drive safely. 
  • Many roads within the fire affected area remain closed. Check the VicTaffic website or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Partial closures of the Grampians National Park remain in place, please visit Parks Vic before you go.
  • Visitors are reminded to be cautious of ongoing risks and changes to the environment which may include fallen or damaged trees, smoke and injured wildlife.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 17/01/2025 01:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

Parts of the Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park re opened to visitors at 9:00am Friday 10 January. For details on access to the park, visit the Parks Vic website. Plan your trip before you leave - visit VicTraffic. - Areas of the Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park will remain closed as they remain extremely dangerous. Fines may apply if you are found behind road closures. Halls Gap opened to visitors on Wednesday 8 January. Community Newsletter no 6: Community newsletter There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.
